title: Novak Djokovic wins Japan Open on injury return in perfect Tokyo 2020 dry run
text:
Djokovic was too good for Millman (Picture: AFP via Getty Images)

Novak Djokovic enjoyed a dream return from injury to win a fourth title of the 2019 season, beating John Millman in straight sets to win the Japan Open.

In what was his first tournament since withdrawing from the US Open with a shoulder issue, Djokovic has been in imperious form and he didn’t drop a set all week.

He beat Australia’s Millman – who came through qualifying to reach just the second ATP final of his career – 6-3 6-2 in a hour and nine minutes to win his 76th ATP Tour title.

John Millman was well beaten (Picture: AFP via Getty Images)

Djokovic told Amazon Prime after winning the title: ‘It was a fantastic week in every sense.

‘I felt great on the court, felt really welcome from the Japanese people off the court as well. They made me feel at home. Didn’t drop a set, played really well, served great… overall great experience.’

Millman gave a glowing review of his opponent after the final ball was struck, adding: ‘It sounds silly to say but I hope everyone all around the world knows how good you are.

‘You’re an absolute champion and you’re the type of person that is going to be remembered forever. Your legacy is continuing to build and just will live on long after you finish playing. I’m sure you’ve got a fair few more years left so congratulations.’

This will be a particularly pleasing win for world No. 1 Djokovic, 32, on his debut at this event, with the site playing host to the 2020 Tokyo Olympics.

A gold medal is the only major title to evade Serbia’s finest tennis export throughout his illustrious career and he has made no secret of his desire to change that next year.

It was his first title since Wimbledon and he equalled Rafael Nadal’s tour-leading total of four titles in 2019.

He will have the chance to surpass the Spaniard in that regard next week at the Shanghai Masters and he has closed the gap in the Race To London – the rankings system that only takes into account points amassed in a calendar year – to less than 1,500 points, with another 1,000 available to him in Shanghai, where the injured Nadal won’t play.

Should Djokovic top the rankings ahead of Nadal come the end of the season, he will equal Pete Sampras’ record six finishes as year-end world No. 1.

Djokovic drew first blood in style. He lured Millman to the net with a short ball and snuck in behind it before anticipating where his opponent would put it and hitting a volleyed pass into the far corner. A quick hold moments later saw him move 4-1 up after 15 minutes.

Little after the half an hour mark, Djokovic was a set to the good and had served five aces.

Another break came to start the second set, with Djokovic tempting several errors off Millman’s racquet and the writing was on the wall. After 49 minutes, Djokovic had a double break and a 3-0 lead.

It didn’t take long for Djokovic to bring the match to a close, winning a tournament on his debut for the 10th time in his career.
